#Text=Chinese political dissident Hu Jia freed as Chinese Premier
#Text=Wen visits Britain
#Text=Tuesday , June 28 , 2011
#Text=Hu Jia Image : Stevenliuyi .
#Text=( Image missing from commons : image ; log )
#Text=The Chinese government released human rights activist Hu Jia from prison on Sunday after he had served over three years for subversion .
#Text=His release , which had been scheduled in advance , occurred just days after controversial artist Ai Weiwei was unexpectedly released on bail after three months of detention .
#Text=Hu was released on the same day that Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao began his visit to Britain , the first country on his three-nation Europe trade tour .

#Text=Described by the Irish Times as a " mild-mannered , slight figure who suffers from liver ailments " , the 37-year-old Hu is a prominent Chinese dissident who had spent years campaigning for civil liberties , environmentalism , and on behalf of suffers of HIV/AIDS before his imprisonment .
#Text=He was imprisoned in April 2008 for " inciting to subvert state power " by writing articles about human rights in the period before the 2008 Olympic Games .
#Text=He had also given many interviews to foreign news media and government embassies .
#Text=He was first detained in December 2007 and his arrest came after he had spent more than 200 days under house arrest .
#Text=In 2008 while in prison , he won the Sakharov Prize for freedom of thought , awarded by the European Parliament .
#Text=Hu 's wife Zeng Jinyuan said via Twitter that her husband lost his political rights upon his release and cannot speak to the media for a period of one year .

#Text=( My parents ) have told me to just be a normal citizen and do n't confront the system because this system is very cruel , using the country 's absolute power to violate people 's dignity without restraint .
#Text=But I can only tell my parents I will be careful .
#Text=— Hu Jia , human rights activist
#Text=Hu was briefly interviewed on Sunday via telephone by Hong Kong 's Cable TV , and indicated that despite the danger , he would not give up his work .

#Text=" ( My parents ) have told me to just be a normal citizen and do n't confront the system because this system is very cruel , using the country 's absolute power to violate people 's dignity without restraint .

#Text=Although recent releases of high-profile dissidents such as Hu and Ai may seem to some that China is loosening its repressive policies against dissidents , activists and academics said yesterday that the determination of the Chinese government to silence dissent has not lessened and those speaking up continue to be rounded up and detained .

#Text= Chinese premier Wen Jiabao visits Shakespeare 's birthplace " — Wikinews , June 27 , 2011
